claim.claim-text: 1. A method for automatically segmenting surgical video data, the method comprising:obtaining, by a computing device, video data for a surgical procedure from a camera configured to capture the video data, wherein the video data comprises a field of view of an anatomical region of a patient during the surgical procedure;generating, by the computing device, a first video data stream and a second video data stream;applying, by an AI processing unit associated with the computing device, one or more machine learning models to the second video data stream;identifying, by the AI processing unit, one or more segments of the second video data stream based on the applied machine learning models; andgenerating, by the AI processing unit, a set of tags associated with the one or more segments of the second video data stream.

2. The method of claim 1, further comprising:associating, by the computing device, the set of tags with the first video data stream; andgenerating, by the computing device, merged video feed data including the one or more tags on the first video data stream.
3. The method of claim 2, wherein the set of tags are stored in video metadata of the first video data stream.

4. The method of claim 2, further comprising:outputting, by the computing device, the merged video feed data for display on a display interface, wherein the merged video feed data is output in real time.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the surgical procedure comprises an arthroscopic surgical procedure.
6. The method of claim 1, wherein the camera is located on an endoscopic device.

7. The method of claim 1, wherein identifying the one or more segments of the second video data stream further comprises:analyzing, by the AI processing unit, each of a plurality of frames in the second video data stream;determining, by the AI processing unit, one or more features present within each of the plurality of video frames in the second video data stream based on the applied machine learning models; andidentifying, by the AI processing unit, the one or more segments of the second video data stream based on the identified one or more features present within each of the plurality of video frames in the second video data stream.

8. The method of claim 7, wherein the determined one or more features present within each of the plurality of video frames comprise an anatomy associated with the surgical procedure and one or more of a tool associated with the surgical procedure, a digital marker, a digital annotation, or an implant.

9. The method of claim 7, wherein the identifying one or more segments of the second video data stream further comprises:comparing, by the AI processing unit, each of the plurality of frames based on the one or more features present with a previous one of the frames in the plurality of frames;identifying, by the AI processing unit, a state change in one of the one or more features based on the comparison; andidentifying, by the AI processing unit, a new segment in the second video data stream based on the identified state change.

10. The method of claim 9, wherein the determined one or more features present within each of the plurality of video frames comprise an anatomy associated with the surgical procedure and one or more of a tool associated with the surgical procedure, a digital marker, a digital annotation, or an implant.

11. The method of claim 10, wherein the state change comprises a change in contact between, and/or presence of, the anatomy and the tool associated with the surgical procedure, or a change in one or more of the tool, the digital marker, the digital annotation, or the implant.
12. The method of claim 1, further comprising:downsampling, by the computing device, the second video data stream prior to the AI processing unit applying the one or more machine learning models.

13. A video data segmentation system, comprising:a camera configured to capture video data, the camera located on an endoscopic device; anda computing device comprising a processor coupled to a memory, the memory storing a program that, when executed by the processor, causes the processor to:obtain video data for a surgical procedure from the camera, wherein the video data comprises a field of view of an anatomical region of a patient during the surgical procedure;generate a first video data stream and a second video data stream;apply one or more machine learning models to the second video data stream;identify one or more segments of the second video data stream based on the applied machine learning models;generate a set of tags associated with the one or more segments of the second video data stream; andoutput a merged video feed data for display on a display interface, wherein the merged video feed data is output in real time.
14.-15. (canceled)

16. The video data segmentation system of claim 13 wherein the program further causes the processor to:associate the set of tags with the first video data stream; andgenerate merged video feed data including the one or more tags on the first video data stream.
17. The video data segmentation system of claim 16, wherein the program further causes the processor to store the set of tags in video metadata of the first video data stream.

18. The video data segmentation system of claim 13, wherein when the processor identifies the one or more segments of the second video data stream, the program causes the processor to:analyze each of a plurality of frames in the second video data stream;determine one or more features present within each of the plurality of video frames in the second video data stream based on the applied machine learning models; andidentify the one or more segments of the second video data stream based on the identified one or more features present within each of the plurality of video frames in the second video data stream.

19. The video data segmentation system of claim 18, wherein the one or more features present within each of the plurality of video frames comprise an anatomy associated with the surgical procedure and one or more of a tool associated with the surgical procedure, a digital marker, a digital annotation, or an implant.

20. The video data segmentation system of claim 18, wherein when the processor identifies one or more segments of the second video data stream, the program further causes the processor to:compare each of the plurality of frames based on the one or more features present with a previous one of the frames in the plurality of frames;identify a state change in one of the one or more features based on the comparison; andidentify a new segment in the second video data stream based on the identified state change.

21. The video data segmentation system of claim 20, wherein the one or more features present within each of the plurality of video frames comprise an anatomy associated with the surgical procedure and one or more of a tool associated with the surgical procedure, a digital marker, a digital annotation, or an implant.

22. The video data segmentation system of claim 21, wherein the state change comprises a change in contact between, and/or presence of, the anatomy and the tool associated with the surgical procedure, or a change in one or more of the tool, the digital marker, the digital annotation, or the implant.

23. The video data segmentation system of claim 13, wherein the program further causes the processor to downsample the second video data stream prior to applying the one or more machine learning models.

24. A non-transitory computer readable-medium having stored thereon instructions for automatically segmenting surgical video data comprising executable code that, when executed by one or more processors, causes the one or more processors to:obtain video data for a surgical procedure from a camera, wherein the video data comprises a field of view of an anatomical region of a patient during the surgical procedure;generate a first video data stream and a second video data stream;apply one or more machine learning models to the second video data stream;identify one or more segments of the second video data stream based on the applied machine learning models;generate a set of tags associated with the one or more segments of the second video data stream; andoutput a merged video feed data for display on a display interface, wherein the merged video feed data is output in real time.

25. The non-transitory computer-readable medium system of claim 24, wherein the instructions further causes the one or more processors to:associate the set of tags with the first video data stream; andgenerate merged video feed data including the one or more tags on the first video data stream.

26. The non-transitory computer-readable medium system of claim 25, wherein the instructions further causes the one or more processor to store the set of tags in video metadata of the first video data stream.
27. The non-transitory computer-readable medium system of claim 24, wherein the surgical procedure comprises an arthroscopic surgical procedure.

28. The non-transitory computer-readable medium system of claim 24, wherein when the one or more processors identify the one or more segments of the second video data stream, the instructions causes the one or more processors to:analyze each of a plurality of frames in the second video data stream;determine one or more features present within each of the plurality of video frames in the second video data stream based on the applied machine learning models; andidentify the one or more segments of the second video data stream based on the identified one or more features present within each of the plurality of video frames in the second video data stream.

29. The non-transitory computer-readable medium system of claim 28, wherein when the one or more processors identify one or more segments of the second video data stream, the instructions further cause the one or more processors to:compare each of the plurality of frames based on the one or more features present with a previous one of the frames in the plurality of frames;identify a state change in one of the one or more features based on the comparison; andidentify a new segment in the second video data stream based on the identified state change.

30. The non-transitory computer-readable medium system of claim 29, wherein the one or more features present within each of the plurality of video frames comprise an anatomy associated with the surgical procedure and one or more of a tool associated with the surgical procedure, a digital marker, a digital annotation, or an implant.

31. The non-transitory computer-readable medium system of claim 30, wherein the state change comprises a change in contact between, and/or presence of, the anatomy and the tool associated with the surgical procedure, or a change in one or more of the tool, the digital marker, the digital annotation, or the implant.
